intro: Cephaelis reniformis, commonly known as the kidneyleaf pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. Cephaelis reniformis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
